instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2533: What is 820-2533? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPBUS_3GH: What is PPBUS_3GH? PPBUS_3GH is a typo of PPBUS_G3H. If you see someone type PPBUS_3GH assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> on fire!
threads.message: hello guys as soon as i plug the charger i see vapor and Is like want to become on  fire I unplug really quick the charger , well I have on my hands a board with damage on one cap going inside the board that is giving ground to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> , any way to solution something like that?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> on fire!
threads.message: Depends on how much damage it have...... My advice: to the pile for parts...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> on fire!
threads.message:
This one went on fire and still works to this day. [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=81kmdfdLuag[/url]

Don't let fire discourage you. Where is the short?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> on fire!
threads.message: Depends on where the damage is and how bad it is. On and old board like this it may not be worth the effort.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> on fire!
threads.message: I saw the video man that's crazy !  the short is on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_3GH</SIGNAL> then the solution to that is lift all the components on that line that are connected and connect then to the wire right? my power is not that great yet to to that on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_3GH</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> on fire!
threads.message: Find the short first, let's not jump to conclusions that it is in the board until that is confirmed. Inject 1v and see what happens.
